Articles.Content:
Through out the summer, I a lot of pictures of China from the P-61 Black widow to the Forbidden City. Here is one from the Summer Palace that I took.

![G4YVRUr.jpg](http://i.imgur.com/G4YVRUr.jpg)

Edit: Relevant photo

![SuaQTXh.jpg](http://i.imgur.com/SuaQTXh.jpg)

What vacation photos did YOU take?

*(PS: follow the forum rules)*

**Edited <time datetime="2015-08-10T01:46:50Z" title="08/10/2015 01:46  AM" data-short="8 yr">August 10, 2015</time> by CelticCossack51**

I am jelly.

I want to leave the states on a vacation sometime. All the cool history happened elsewhere.

Psh, one of these years I'll be able to go on a vacation. Maybe. ![:)](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_smiley.gif)

Edit: Also, awesome photo!
hmmm wow so beautiful ... thanks to share this

![11160612_10152766148245863_6221598942196011083_o.jpg](https://scontent-lhr.xx.fbcdn.net/hphotos-xpf1/t31.0-8/11160612_10152766148245863_6221598942196011083_o.jpg)

Just up the road (Beinn Chabhair, Scottish Highlands, looking back south towards Ben Lomond)
^^^ pretty country. I have to drive a few hours north to Colorado for anything like that.

> 
> Through out the summer, I a lot of pictures of China from the P-61 Black widow to the Forbidden City. Here is one from the Summer Palace that I took.
> What vacation photos did YOU take?
> 
> *(PS: follow the forum rules)*

I know those steps! Kind of a boring photo to take from the Summer Palace though...

I was in China over christmas/new year period, and took a lot of photos (around 600).

Here is one for you

![wzvCbGH.jpg](http://i.imgur.com/wzvCbGH.jpg)

Sadly, the photo doesn't really do the place justice.

Very good photos!

I have some more to share.

![7uB3BHU.jpg](http://i.imgur.com/7uB3BHU.jpg)

![tRw9FVz.jpg](http://i.imgur.com/tRw9FVz.jpg)

![viBbfko.jpg](http://i.imgur.com/viBbfko.jpg)

I also stopped by Paris on that same day. Please ignore the Chinese trees!

![JaiuQEv.jpg](http://i.imgur.com/JaiuQEv.jpg)

I did not expect to find this flag when I went to Britannia Historical Shipyard in Richmond. Can you guess what country this belonged to?

![Z3YExe5.jpg](http://i.imgur.com/Z3YExe5.jpg)

Isn't it the flag of the Manchu dynasty?

On the first day after the exams I visited a nice train spotting place on the Budapest-Vienna main line near the village of SzÃƒÂ¡r:

![MQeKtNR.jpg](http://i.imgur.com/MQeKtNR.jpg)

> 
> Isn't it the flag of the Manchu dynasty?

It would be the Qing dynasty, but otherwise it's correct. And also nice picture!
